honeywell

Class Monitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • honeywell.Monitor

  • public class Monitor
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a C# style Monitor class. This allows us to try a lock and time out if the object is locked.

    • Constructor Summary

      Monitor()

    • Method Detail

      • enter

        public static void enter(java.lang.Object lockObject)
        Acquires an exclusive lock on the specified object.

        Use Enter to acquire the Monitor on the object passed as the parameter. If another thread has executed an Enter on the object, but has not yet executed the corresponding Exit, the current thread will block until the other thread releases the object. It is legal for the same thread to invoke Enter more than once without it blocking; however, an equal number of Exit calls must be invoked before other threads waiting on the object will unblock.

        Parameters:
        lockObject - The object on which to acquire the monitor lock.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the lockObject is null

      • exit

        public static void exit(java.lang.Object lockObject)
        Releases an exclusive lock on the specified object.

        The calling thread must own the lock on the lockObject parameter. If the calling thread owns the lock on the specified object, and has made an equal number of Exit and Enter calls for the object, then the lock is released. If the calling thread has not invoked Exit as many times as Enter, the lock is not released.

        Parameters:
        lockObject - The object on which to acquire the monitor lock.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the lockObject is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if lockObject is currently locked by another thread.

      • tryEnter

        public static boolean tryEnter(java.lang.Object lockObject,
                               long timeout)
        Attempts, for the specified number of milliseconds, to acquire an exclusive lock on the specified object.
        Parameters:
        lockObject - The object on which to acquire the monitor lock.
        timeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for the lock.
        Returns:
        true if the current thread acquires the lock; otherwise, false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the lockObject is null or if timeout is negative
